tasks.name: Motor Imagery (MI)
tasks.definition: Motor imagery (MI) is a dynamic mental state during which representations of a given motor act are internally rehearsed in working memory without any overt motor output. This study explored different characteristics of brain activation among target-oriented kinesthetic imagery (KI) and visual imagery (VI) in the first-person (VI-1) and third-person (VI-3) perspectives.
conditions: Visual Imagery in the first-person perspective (VI-1)
Visual Imagery in the third-person perspective (VI-3)
